definition: to dismember/(fig.) to break into parts
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: When I read this novel, I see a lot of dismembered body parts.
sentences.chinese: 我读到了身体的部分，被肢解的身体。

sentences.english: There is also in the Bodleian Library a mutilated leaf of a very tiny Greek MS.
sentences.chinese: 也有在国立图书馆肢解叶的一个非常微小的希女士。

sentences.english: If you like, you can also dismember them.
sentences.chinese: 如果玩者乐意的话，还可以肢解受害者的尸体。

sentences.english: I seek to dismember , a sadist fiend.
Last year Mr. Liu killed and dismembered an 8-year-old Hainan girl.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧的是，刘在去年杀害并肢解了海南一名八岁女孩。

sentences.english: Young co- eds are being cut up by a chainsaw killer on a college campus.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的女大学生在校园内被一个电锯杀手肢解。

sentences.english: There were bodies strewn everywhere, many dismembered and some even half consumed.
sentences.chinese: 地上尸横遍野，很多都被肢解，有些甚至被吞噬大半。

sentences.english: He stabbed her to death, dismembered her body, and stuffed the pieces into garbage bags.
sentences.chinese: 他将她捅死了，肢解了她的尸体，装进垃圾袋扔掉了。

sentences.english: The criminal killed and disjointed her.
The Accidental Death and Dismemberment benefit is deleted during the course of the activity.
sentences.chinese: 意外死亡和肢解的好处是删除过程中的活动。

sentences.english: First of all I dismembered the corpse.
Local officials say some victims were mutilated and beheaded.
sentences.chinese: 地方官员透露其中一些受害者被肢解和斩首。

sentences.english: I was wondering about cattle mutilations .
The traitor was condemned to be hanged, drawn and quartered.
sentences.chinese: 那叛国者被处绞刑，取去内脏并肢解。

sentences.english: The top of the head interlocks, but the antenna, is dividing the unclear not dark sky.
sentences.chinese: 头顶交织而过的天线，肢解着不明不暗的天外。

definition: all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
to ravage/to devastate/to trample on/to violate
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
